title: What is the difference between AMOLED and OLED? - Quora

response.answer_text: Almost every OLED screen on your devices is AMOLED (regardless of the marketing name) That is because an OLED display can be driven with a passive-matrix (PMOLED) or active-matrix (AMOLED) control scheme. AMOLED and PMOLED are the the only 2 types of OLED screens. AMOLED is everywhere. PMOLED is very rare; has restrictions on size and resolution (used in mp3 players). The real difference is between the TYPES of AMOLED screens. PS. POLED is a marketing tool used mainly by LG for its (AM)OLED displays because of the plastic material used instead of glass for its curved screens. Super AMOLED is a marketing tool used mainly by Samsung for its (AM)OLED displays. Samsung also uses plastic instead of glass for its curved screens. It took me some time to find an actual answer because people explain what OLED is. If I wanted to know what OLED is I’d probably look for a different question. source: OLED Info | The OLED Experts, OLED - Wikipedia, AMOLED - Wikipedia, LG’s OLED phone screens are bad, but its TVs are top-notch
